title: Intra-doc links do not use dev-dependencies

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

labels.name: A-intra-doc-links
labels.description: Area: Intra-doc links, the ability to link to items in docs by name

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
// In crate foo
pub struct MyStruct {}
```

```rust
// in crate bar
//! A link to [`foo::MyStruct`]
```

If I put `foo` in `bar`'s dev-dependencies, the intra-doc links do not generate, and a warning

```
no item named `foo::MyStruct` in scope
```

turns out. If I put `foo` in `bar`'s dependencies instead, there is no warning and the intra-doc links are generated correctly.

This situation is quite common when we are writing a proc macro crate `a`, which provides derive macros for another crate `b`. We put `a` in `b`'s dependencies, and put `b` in `a`'s dev-dependencies for writing docs for `a`.
